content.text: Work out her age in months
Div has \(25 to buy some cups which cost\) 4.25 each
Calculate the maximum number of cups he can buy and the change he receives
Write down the mathematical name of this type of angle
divisible by an even cube number
From this list, write down the number that is
A farmer plants \(t\) trees each day
Write an expression for the number of trees he plants in \(d\) days
\(x\) passengers get off the train and \(y\) passengers get on the train
Write an expression for the number of passengers on the train now
Raj thinks of a negative number, \(n\)
He adds 10 to \(n\) and then multiplies by 5
Angle \(A\) and angle ................ are corresponding angles
The diagram shows a straight line crossing a pair of parallel lines
Write down the term-to-term rule for continuing this sequence
Find the next two terms in this sequence
These are the first four terms of a sequence
Calculate the surface area of the cuboid
Work out the values of \(A\), \(B\) and \(C\)
The table shows an ordered stem-and-leaf diagram
Find the actual distance between \(P\) and \(Q\)
A boat, \(B\), is on a bearing of \(127^{\circ}\) from \(P\)
The scale drawing shows the positions of two lighthouses, \(P\) and \(Q\)
The scale is 1 centimetre represents 0.8 kilometres
Mo asks some people if they prefer sun, rain or wind
The pie chart shows the results
45 more people prefer wind than rain
Work out how many people prefer sun
Use the exchange rates to calculate how many krona she receives
Give your answer correct to the nearest krona
A car travels \(95\mathrm{km}\) in 2 hours and 15 minutes
Calculate the average speed of the car in \(\mathrm{km / h}\)
Calculate the value of the largest share
Clare invests \(12 000 for 3 years at a rate of 8\%\) per year compound interest
Calculate the value of her investment at the end of the 3 years
Give your answer correct to the nearest \(10
After one year his investment is worth \(630
Write 2025 as the product of its prime factors
Write 2025 as a product of two square numbers that are both greater than one
On the grid, draw the image of shape \(A\) after a rotation, \(90^{\circ}\) clockwise, centre \((0, 3)\)
Describe fully the **single** transformation that maps
Calculate the size of the smallest angle in triangle \(C\)
The diagram shows three shapes, \(A, B\) and \(C\), on a \(1 \mathrm{cm}^2\) grid
Show that the sum of the interior angles of a pentagon is \(540^{\circ}\)
Write down an expression, in terms of \(x\), for the sum of the interior angles of the pentagon. Give your answer in its simplest form
In this part, all angles are in degrees
The diagram shows the five interior angles of a pentagon, written in terms of \(x\)
